org.wmn4j.mir

Interface Pattern

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MonophonicPattern, PolyphonicPattern

    public interface Pattern
    Interface for musical patterns. The patterns can represent motifs, melodies, or segments of polyphonic music. A pattern is a sequence of notes, chords, and rests. A pattern can be monophonic or polyphonic. In a monophonic pattern there are no simultaneously occurring notes or chords. In a polyphonic pattern there can be multiple notes occurring at the same time in chords or in multiple voices.
    Author:
    Otso Bj√∂rklund

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Pattern other)
      Returns true if this Pattern is equal to other.
      boolean equalsEnharmonicallyInPitch(Pattern other)
      Returns true if this Pattern contains the enharmonically same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false.
      boolean equalsInOnsets(Pattern other)
      Returns true if the onset times of notes in this Pattern match the onset times of notes in other, otherwise returns false.
      boolean equalsInPitch(Pattern other)
      Returns true if this Pattern contains the same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false.
      boolean equalsInRhythm(Pattern other)
      Returns true if this Pattern has the same rhythm as other.
      boolean equalsInTransposedPitch(Pattern other)
      Returns true if this Pattern can be transposed so that its pitches are enharmonically equal to those of other, otherwise returns false.
      boolean isMonophonic()
      Returns true if this pattern does not contain any notes occur simultaneously, otherwise returns false.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(Pattern other)
        Returns true if this Pattern is equal to other.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern this is compared against for equality
        Returns:
        true if this pattern contains the exact same notes, rest, and chords in the same order as other. Otherwise returns false.

      • isMonophonic

        boolean isMonophonic()
        Returns true if this pattern does not contain any notes occur simultaneously, otherwise returns false.
        Returns:
        true if this pattern does not contain any notes occur simultaneously. Otherwise returns false.

      • equalsInPitch

        boolean equalsInPitch(Pattern other)
        Returns true if this Pattern contains the same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false. The pitches must be spelled the same way for the patterns to be considered equal in pitch. Rhythm is ignored.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern against which this is compared for pitch equality.
        Returns:
        true if this Pattern contains the same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false

      • equalsEnharmonicallyInPitch

        boolean equalsEnharmonicallyInPitch(Pattern other)
        Returns true if this Pattern contains the enharmonically same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false. The pitch spellings are not considered, but they are compared using enharmonic equality. Rhythm is ignored.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern against which this is compared for enharmonic pitch equality.
        Returns:
        true if this Pattern contains the enharmonically same pitches in the same order as other, otherwise returns false

      • equalsInTransposedPitch

        boolean equalsInTransposedPitch(Pattern other)
        Returns true if this Pattern can be transposed so that its pitches are enharmonically equal to those of other, otherwise returns false.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern against which this is compared for transposed enharmonic pitch equality.
        Returns:
        true if this Pattern can be transposed so that its pitches are enharmonically equal to those of other, otherwise returns false

      • equalsInRhythm

        boolean equalsInRhythm(Pattern other)
        Returns true if this Pattern has the same rhythm as other. Both the onsets and durations must match for rhythms to be considered equal. Pitches are ignored.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern against which this is compared for rhythm equality.
        Returns:
        true if this Pattern has the same rhythm as other, otherwise returns false

      • equalsInOnsets

        boolean equalsInOnsets(Pattern other)
        Returns true if the onset times of notes in this Pattern match the onset times of notes in other, otherwise returns false. Pitches are ignored.
        Parameters:
        other - the Pattern against which this is compared for onset equality.
        Returns:
        true if the onset times of notes in this Pattern match the onset times of notes in other, otherwise returns false
